get.description: Authenticates users via Basic auth (email:bencher-api-token) and returns a short-lived JWT for OCI operations.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope in format "repository:name:action,action" e.g., "repository:org/project:pull,push"

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Service identifier (e.g., "registry.bencher.dev") Not currently used but accepted for OCI spec compliance

post.summary: When a user signs up, a new personal organization is automatically created.
post.description: Except when a user signs up with an invitation, then the user is just added to the inviting organization.

get.description: List all organizations where the user is a member. The user must have `view` permissions for each organization. By default, the organizations are sorted in alphabetical order by name. The HTTP response header `X-Total-Count` contains the total number of organizations.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort by. If not specified, the default sort direction is used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. If not specified, the first page is returned.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page. If not specified, the default number of items per page (8) is used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by. If not specified, the default sort field is used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by organization name, exact match.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by organization name, slug, or UUID.

post.description: Create a new organization. The user must be authenticated to use this route.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

delete.description: Delete an organization where the user is a member. The user must have `delete` permissions for the organization.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

patch.description: Update an organization where the user is a member. The user must have `edit` permissions for the organization. If updating the license, the user must have `manage` permissions for the organization.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.description: Search by user name, slug, or UUID.

post.summary: Invite a user to an organization
post.description: Invite another user to become a member of an organization. The user must have `create_role` permissions for the organization. The invitee is sent an email with a link to accept the invitation, and they are not added to the organization until they accept the invitation.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort by. If not specified, the default sort direction is used.

parameters.description: Filter by project name, exact match.

parameters.name: search

post.summary: Create a project for an organization
post.description: Create a new project for an organization. The user must have `create` permissions for the organization. The new project will have a `main` branch, a `localhost` testbed, `latency` and `throughput` measures, and a threshold for both measures.  Bencher Plus: The project visibility must be `public` unless the organization has a valid Bencher Plus subscription.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

get.summary: List SSO domains for an organization
get.description: Bencher Plus: List all single sign-on (SSO) domains for an organization. The user must be a member of the organization to use this route.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort by. If not specified, the default sort direction is used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. If not specified, the first page is returned.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page. If not specified, the default number of items per page (8) is used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by. If not specified, the default sort field is used.

post.summary: Add an SSO domain to an organization
post.description: Bencher Plus: Add a single sign-on (SSO) domain to an organization. The user must be an admin on the server to use this route. When a user authenticates with the server, the domain portion of their email will be compared against all SSO domains. If an SSO domain matches, they will be added as a Member to that Organization. SSO domains must be globally unique on the server. That is, two Organizations cannot have the same SSO domain.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

get.summary: View an SSO domain for an organization
get.description: Bencher Plus: View a single sign-on (SSO) domain from an organization. The user must be a member of the organization to use this route.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.name: sso
parameters.description: The UUID for an SSO domain.

delete.summary: Remove an SSO domain from an organization
delete.description: Bencher Plus: Remove a single sign-on (SSO) domain from an organization. The user must be an admin on the server to use this route.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

parameters.name: sso
parameters.description: The UUID for an SSO domain.

get.description: View the metrics usage of an organization. The user must have `manage` permissions for the organization.  Bencher Plus: This endpoint offers an estimate of metered usage and exact usage for licensed organizations, both on Bencher Cloud and Bencher Self-Hosted.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for an organization.

get.description: List all projects. If the user is not authenticated, then only public projects are returned. If the user is authenticated, then all public projects and any private project where the user has `view` permissions are returned. By default, the projects are sorted in alphabetical order by name. The HTTP response header `X-Total-Count` contains the total number of projects.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort by. If not specified, the default sort direction is used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. If not specified, the first page is returned.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page. If not specified, the default number of items per page (8) is used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by. If not specified, the default sort field is used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by project name, exact match.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by project name, slug, or UUID.

get.description: View a project. If the user is not authenticated, then only a public project is available. If the user is authenticated, then any public project and any private project where the user has `view` permissions is available.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

delete.description: Delete a project. The user must have `delete` permissions for the project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

patch.description: Update a project. The user must have `edit` permissions for the project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

get.description: List all alerts for a project. If the project is public, then the user does not need to be authenticated. If the project is private, then the user must be authenticated and have `view` permissions for the project. By default, the alerts are sorted by status (active then dismissed) and modification date time in reverse chronological order. The HTTP response header `X-Total-Count` contains the total number of alerts.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort by. If not specified, the default sort direction is used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. If not specified, the first page is returned.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page. If not specified, the default number of items per page (8) is used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by. If not specified, the default sort field is used.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: If set to `true`, only returns archived alerts. If not set or set to `false`, only returns alerts with non-archived branches, testbeds, or measures.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter alerts by their status. If not set, returns all alerts.

get.description: View an alert for a project. If the project is public, then the user does not need to be authenticated. If the project is private, then the user must be authenticated and have `view` permissions for the project.

parameters.name: alert
parameters.description: The UUID for an alert.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

patch.description: Update an alert for a project. The user must have `edit` permissions for the project. Use this endpoint to dismiss an alert.

parameters.description: The UUID for an alert.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: The permission to check.

parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: The UUID for a metric.

parameters.name: project

get.description: Query the performance metrics for a project. The query results are every permutation of each branch, testbed, benchmark, and measure. There is a limit of 255 permutations for a single request. Therefore, only the first 255 permutations are returned. If the project is public, then the user does not need to be authenticated. If the project is private, then the user must be authenticated and have `view` permissions for the project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

parameters.name: benchmarks
parameters.description: A comma separated list of benchmark UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: A comma separated list of branch UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Search for metrics before the given date time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: heads
parameters.description: An optional comma separated list of branch head UUIDs. To not specify a particular branch head leave an empty entry in the list.

parameters.name: measures
parameters.description: A comma separated list of measure UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Search for metrics after the given date time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: testbeds
parameters.description: A comma separated list of testbed UUIDs to query.

get.summary: Generate a dynamic image of project performance metrics
get.description: Generate a dynamic image of performance metrics for a project. The query results are every permutation of each branch, testbed, benchmark, and measure. There is a limit of 8 permutations for a single image. Therefore, only the first 8 permutations are plotted. If the project is public, then the user does not need to be authenticated. If the project is private, then the user must be authenticated and have `view` permissions for the project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The slug or UUID for a project.

parameters.name: benchmarks
parameters.description: A comma separated list of benchmark UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: A comma separated list of branch UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Search for metrics before the given date time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: heads
parameters.description: An optional comma separated list of branch head UUIDs. To not specify a particular branch head leave an empty entry in the list.

parameters.name: measures
parameters.description: A comma separated list of measure UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Search for metrics after the given date time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: testbeds
parameters.description: A comma separated list of testbed UUIDs to query.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the perf plot. If not provided, the project name will be used.

get.description: List all thresholds for a project. If the project is public, then the user does not need to be authenticated. If the project is private, then the user must be authenticated and have `view` permissions for the project. By default, the thresholds are sorted by creation date time in chronological order. The HTTP response header `X-Total-Count` contains the total number of thresholds.

get.description: Returns 200 OK if authenticated and the registry implements the OCI Distribution Spec. Returns 401 Unauthorized with WWW-Authenticate header if not authenticated.
Streams the blob content rather than loading it entirely into memory, making this suitable for large container image layers.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Project resource ID (UUID or slug)

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: Reference - either a digest (e.g., "sha256:abc123...") or "uploads"

put.description:
Uploads a complete blob in a single request. This is convenient for small blobs but has memory limitations: Dropshot's `UntypedBody` buffers the entire request into memory. For large blobs, use the chunked upload flow instead (see `uploads` module).

# Memory Limitation

The entire blob content is buffered in server memory before being stored. This means practical upload sizes are limited by available server memory. For blobs larger than a few MB, consider using chunked uploads:

1. `POST /v2/{name}/blobs/uploads` - Start session 2. `PATCH /v2/{name}/blobs/uploads/{session_id}` - Upload chunks 3. `PUT /v2/{name}/blobs/uploads/{session_id}?digest=...` - Complete

# Authentication

Authentication is optional for unclaimed projects. If the project's organization is claimed, valid authentication with Create permission is required. If the project doesn't exist and a slug is used, the project will be created automatically.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Project resource ID (UUID or slug)

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: Reference - either a digest (e.g., "sha256:abc123...") or "uploads"

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Expected digest of the complete blob

patch.description:
Appends a chunk of data to an in-progress upload session. This is the recommended approach for large blobs, as each chunk is stored immediately rather than buffering the entire blob in memory.

Clients can call this endpoint multiple times to upload a blob in pieces, then call `PUT /v2/{name}/blobs/uploads/{session_id}?digest=...` to complete the upload.

The `Content-Range` header is optional but recommended - if provided, the server validates that the chunk starts at the expected offset.

parameters.description: Project resource ID (UUID or slug)

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: Must be "uploads" for upload operations

parameters.description: Upload session ID

JobUpdateStatus.description:
Restricted job status for runner update requests.

Only allows the statuses that a runner can set when updating a job: Running, Completed, or Failed. Pending, Claimed, and Canceled are server-managed statuses that runners cannot set.

compress.description: Compress the database backup with gzip. This operation runs first.

data_store.description: Save the database backup to this data store. This operation runs second.

rm.description: Remove the local copy of the database backup. This operation runs third.

JsonClaimJob.description: Request to claim a job (runner agent endpoint)

poll_timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for a job (long-poll), in seconds (1-600)

JsonClaimedJob.description:
A claimed job returned to the runner agent.

Standalone type containing everything a runner needs to execute a job. Config and OCI token are always present (not Optional) since they are guaranteed at claim time.

config.description: Execution config  always present for claimed jobs

spec.description: Full spec details (architecture, cpu, memory, etc.)

url.description: The URL for the Bencher Console UI.

busy_timeout.description: The database busy timeout in milliseconds

config.description: Job configuration (only included when claimed by a runner)

output.description: Job output (stdout, stderr, files) from blob storage, included for terminal jobs.

JsonJobConfig.description:
Job configuration sent to runners.

Contains the execution details needed for a runner to execute a job. Designed to minimize data leakage - runners only learn what's necessary to pull and execute an OCI image. Resource requirements (cpu, memory, disk, network) are in the associated spec.

env.description: Environment variables passed to the container

file_paths.description: File paths to read from the VM after job completion

project.description: Project UUID for OCI authentication scoping

registry.description: Registry URL for pulling the OCI image (e.g., `https://registry.bencher.dev`)

JsonJobOutput.description: Job output stored in blob storage after job completion or failure.

error.description: Error message (present when the job failed).

created.description: The date time the member was created.

modified.description: The date time the member was last modified.

name.description: The member user name.
The name of the benchmark. Maximum length is 1,024 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the benchmark. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

name.description: The name of the branch. Maximum length is 256 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the branch. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

start_point.description: The start point for the new branch. Historical branch versions from the start point branch will be shallow copied over to the new branch head. That is, historical metrics data for the start point branch will appear in queries for the new branch. For example, pull request branches often use their base branch as their start point branch. After the new branch is created, it is not kept in sync with the start point branch. If not provided, the new branch will have no historical data.

name.description: The name of the measure. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the measure. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

units.description: The units of measure. Maximum length is 64 characters.

email.description: The email for the invitee. This will be used to both send the invite and to create the user account if they do not exist.

name.description: The user name for the invitee.

role.description: The organization role for the invitee.

name.description: The name of the organization. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the organization. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

benchmarks.description: The benchmarks to include in the plot. At least one benchmark must be specified.

branches.description: The branches to include in the plot. At least one branch must be specified.

index.description: The index of the plot. Maximum index is 64.

measures.description: The measures to include in the plot. At least one measure must be specified.

testbeds.description: The testbeds to include in the plot. At least one testbed must be specified.

title.description: The title of the plot. Maximum length is 64 characters.

window.description: The window of time for the plot, in seconds. Metrics outside of this window will be omitted.

x_axis.description: The x-axis to use for the plot.

name.description: The name of the project. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the project. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

url.description: The URL for the project. If the project is public, the URL will be accessible listed on its Perf Page.

visibility.description: Bencher Plus: Set the visibility of the project. Creating a `private` project requires a valid Bencher Plus subscription.

branch.description: Branch UUID, slug, or name. If the branch does not exist, it will be created.

end_time.description: End time for the report. Must be an ISO 8601 formatted string.

hash.description: Full `git` commit hash. All reports with the same `git` commit hash will be considered part of the same branch version. This can be useful for tracking the performance of a specific commit across multiple testbeds.

results.description: An array of benchmarks results in Bencher Metric Format (BMF).

settings.description: Settings for how to handle the report.

start_point.description: The start point for the report branch. If the branch does not exist, the start point will be used to create a new branch. If the branch already exists and the start point is not provided, the current branch will be used. If the branch already exists and the start point provided is different, a new branch head will be created from the new start point. If a new branch or new branch head is created with a start point, historical branch versions from the start point branch will be shallow copied over to the new branch. That is, historical metrics data for the start point branch will appear in queries for the branch. For example, pull request branches often use their base branch as their start point branch. If a new branch is created, it is not kept in sync with the start point branch.

start_time.description: Start time for the report. Must be an ISO 8601 formatted string.

testbed.description: Testbed UUID, slug, or name. If the testbed does not exist, it will be created.

thresholds.description: Thresholds to use for the branch, testbed, and measures in the report. If a threshold does not exist, it will be created. If a threshold exists and the model is different, it will be updated with the new model. If a measure name or slug is provided, the measure will be created if it does not exist.

branch.description: Branch UUID, slug, or name. If the branch is not provided or does not exist, it will be created.

end_time.description: End time for the report. Must be an ISO 8601 formatted string.

hash.description: Full `git` commit hash. All reports with the same `git` commit hash will be considered part of the same branch version. This can be useful for tracking the performance of a specific commit across multiple testbeds.

project.description: Project UUID or slug. If the project is not provided or does not exist, it will be created.

results.description: An array of benchmarks results in Bencher Metric Format (BMF).

settings.description: Settings for how to handle the results.

start_point.description: The start point for the report branch. If the branch does not exist, the start point will be used to create a new branch. If the branch already exists and the start point is not provided, the current branch will be used. If the branch already exists and the start point provided is different, a new branch head will be created from the new start point. If a new branch or new branch head is created with a start point, historical branch versions from the start point branch will be shallow copied over to the new branch. That is, historical metrics data for the start point branch will appear in queries for the branch. For example, pull request branches often use their base branch as their start point branch. If a new branch is created, it is not kept in sync with the start point branch.

start_time.description: Start time for the report. Must be an ISO 8601 formatted string.

testbed.description: Testbed UUID, slug, or name. If the testbed is not provided or does not exist, it will be created.

thresholds.description: Thresholds to use for the branch, testbed, and measures in the report. If a threshold does not exist, it will be created. If a threshold exists and the model is different, it will be updated with the new model. If a measure name or slug is provided, the measure will be created if it does not exist.

name.description: The name of the runner.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the runner. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name.

JsonNewRunnerSpec.description: Add a spec to a runner

spec.description: The UUID or slug of the spec to associate with the runner.

name.description: The name of the spec.

network.description: Whether the VM has network access

slug.description: The preferred slug for the spec. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name.

domain.description: The SSO domain. For example: example.com

branch.description: The UUID, slug, or name of the branch to use as the start point.

clone_thresholds.description: If set to `true`, the thresholds from the start point branch will be deep copied to the new branch. This can be useful for pull request branches that should have the same thresholds as their target branch. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

hash.description: The full `git` hash of the branch to use as the start point. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

max_versions.description: The maximum number of historical branch versions to include. Versions beyond this number will be omitted. The default is 255. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

name.description: The name of the testbed. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred slug for the testbed. If not provided, the slug will be generated from the name. If the provided or generated slug is already in use, a unique slug will be generated. Maximum length is 64 characters.

branch.description: The UUID, slug, or name of the threshold branch.

lower_boundary.description: The lower boundary used to calculate the lower boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

max_sample_size.description: The maximum number of samples used to perform the test. Only the most recent samples will be used if there are more.

measure.description: The UUID, slug, or name of the threshold measure.

min_sample_size.description: The minimum number of samples required to perform the test. If there are fewer samples, the test will not be performed.

test.description: The test used by the threshold model to calculate the baseline and boundary limits.

testbed.description: The UUID, slug, or name of the threshold testbed.

upper_boundary.description: The upper boundary used to calculate the upper boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

window.description: The window of time for samples used to perform the test, in seconds. Samples outside of this window will be omitted.

name.description: The name of the token. Maximum length is 64 characters.

ttl.description: The time-to-live (TTL) for the token in seconds. If not provided, the token will not expire for over 128 years.

license.description: Bencher Plus: The new license for the organization. Set to `null` to remove the current license.

name.description: The new name of the organization. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the organization. Maximum length is 64 characters.

interval.description: The OTEL export interval in seconds. Defaults to 15 seconds, if not specified.

index.description: The new index for the plot. Maximum index is 64.

title.description: The new title of the plot. Set to `null` to remove the current title. Maximum length is 64 characters.

window.description: The window of time for the plot, in seconds. Metrics outside of this window will be omitted.

name.description: The new name of the project. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the project. Maximum length is 64 characters.

url.description: The new URL of the project. Set to `null` to remove the current URL.

visibility.description: Bencher Plus: Set the new visibility of the project. Moving to a `private` project requires a valid Bencher Plus subscription.

min_score.description: The minimum acceptable score for reCAPTCHA verification.

secret.description: The shared key between your site and reCAPTCHA.

data_store.description: S3 storage configuration for the container registry

max_body_size.description: Maximum body size in bytes for blob and manifest uploads. Requests exceeding this limit are rejected with 413 Payload Too Large. Defaults to 1 GiB (1,073,741,824 bytes).

upload_timeout.description: Upload session timeout in seconds. Uploads older than this are cleaned up when new uploads start. Defaults to 3600 (1 hour).

adapter.description: The benchmark harness adapter for parsing the benchmark results. If no adapter is specified, then the Magic adapter will be used.

average.description: Benchmark harness suggested central tendency (ie average). Some benchmarking harnesses provide multiple averages, such as mean and median.

fold.description: Fold multiple results into a single result using the selected operation. This can be useful for taking the min, max, mean, or median of the benchmark results.

models.description: Map of measure UUID, slug, or name to the threshold model to use. If a measure name or slug is provided, the measure will be created if it does not exist.

reset.description: Reset all thresholds for the branch and testbed. Any models present in the `models` field will still be updated accordingly. If a threshold already exists and is not present in the `models` field, its current model will be removed.

delay.description: The delay in seconds before the server restarts. Defaults to 3 seconds, if not specified.

JsonRunnerToken.description: Runner token response (returned on create or rotate)

token.description: The runner token. Only shown once - store it securely!

heartbeat_timeout.description: Time in seconds without a heartbeat before marking a job as failed. Defaults to 90 seconds.

job_timeout_grace_period.description: Extra time in seconds beyond a job's configured timeout before the server cancels it. Defaults to 60 seconds.

created.description: The date the server was created

version.description: The current version of the server

active_projects.description: Number of active projects (with at least one report)

active_projects_claimed.description: Number of active claimed projects (with at least one report)

active_projects_unclaimed.description: Number of active unclaimed projects (with at least one report)

metrics_per_report_claimed.description: Number of metrics per claimed report (created)

metrics_per_report_unclaimed.description: Number of metrics per unclaimed report (created)

reports_per_project.description: Number of reports per active project (created)

reports_per_project_claimed.description: Number of reports per active claimed project (created)

reports_per_project_unclaimed.description: Number of reports per active unclaimed project (created)

i_agree.description: I agree to the Bencher Terms of Use (https://bencher.dev/legal/terms-of-use), Privacy Policy (https://bencher.dev/legal/privacy), and License Agreement (https://bencher.dev/legal/license)

status.description: The new status of the alert.

archived.description: Set whether the benchmark is archived.

name.description: The new name of the benchmark. Maximum length is 1,024 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the benchmark. Maximum length is 64 characters.

archived.description: Set whether the branch is archived.

name.description: The new name of the branch. Maximum length is 256 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the branch. Maximum length is 64 characters.

start_point.description: The new start point for the branch.

status.description: The current status of the job after the update

archived.description: Set whether the measure is archived.

name.description: The new name of the measure. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the measure. Maximum length is 64 characters.

units.description: The new units of measure. Maximum length is 64 characters.

role.description: The new organization role for the member.

lower_boundary.description: The lower boundary used to calculate the lower boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

max_sample_size.description: The maximum number of samples used to perform the test. Only the most recent samples will be used if there are more.

min_sample_size.description: The minimum number of samples required to perform the test. If there are fewer samples, the test will not be performed.

test.description: The test used by the threshold model to calculate the baseline and boundary limits.

upper_boundary.description: The upper boundary used to calculate the upper boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

window.description: The window of time for samples used to perform the test, in seconds. Samples outside of this window will be omitted.

archived.description: Set whether the runner is archived.

name.description: The new name for the runner.

slug.description: The new slug for the runner.

archived.description: Set whether the spec is archived.

name.description: The new name for the spec.

slug.description: The new slug for the spec.

branch.description: The UUID, slug, or name of the branch to use as the start point.

clone_thresholds.description: If set to `true`, the thresholds from the start point branch will be deep copied to the branch. This can be useful for pull request branches that should have the same thresholds as their target branch. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

hash.description: The full git hash of the branch to use as the start point. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

max_versions.description: The maximum number of historical branch versions to include. Versions beyond this number will be omitted. The default is 255. Requires the `branch` field to be set.

reset.description: Reset the branch head to an empty state. If the start point `branch` is specified, the new branch head will begin at that start point. Otherwise, the branch head will be reset to an empty state.

archived.description: Set whether the testbed is archived.

name.description: The new name of the testbed. Maximum length is 64 characters.

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the testbed. Maximum length is 64 characters.

name.description: The new name of the token. Maximum length is 64 characters.

admin.description: Update whether the user is an admin. Must be an admin to update this field.

email.description: The new email for the user.

locked.description: Update whether the user is locked. Must be an admin to update this field.

name.description: The new name of the user. Maximum length is 64 characters. May only contain alphanumeric characters, non-leading or trailing spaces, and the following characters: , . - '

slug.description: The preferred new slug for the user. Maximum length is 64 characters.

end_time.description: The end time of the usage.

start_time.description: The start time of the usage.

lower_boundary.description: The lower boundary used to calculate the lower boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

max_sample_size.description: The maximum number of samples used to perform the test. Only the most recent samples will be used if there are more.

min_sample_size.description: The minimum number of samples required to perform the test. If there are fewer samples, the test will not be performed.

test.description: The test used by the threshold model to calculate the baseline and boundary limits.

upper_boundary.description: The upper boundary used to calculate the upper boundary limit. The requirements for this field depend on which `test` is selected.

window.description: The window of time for samples used to perform the test, in seconds. Samples outside of this window will be omitted.

access_point.description: S3 Access Point ARN with optional path prefix Format: arn:aws:s3:<region>:<account-id>:accesspoint/<bucket>[/path]

oneOf.description: The alert has been dismissed by a user.
Sort by alert creation date time.
Sort by alert modified date time.
Sort by threshold creation date time.
Sort by threshold modified date time.
